results.title: Animated
results.brief_description: An off-the-wall, engagingly funny, slightly serious and brilliantly assembled collection of the maddest moments of Australia’s unsung film art. A film which rolls 75 years of history into 80 rip roaring minutes of fun and hi-jinx.
results.description: An off-the-wall, engagingly funny, slightly serious and brilliantly assembled collection of the maddest moments of Australia’s unsung film art. A film which rolls 75 years of history into 80 rip roaring minutes of fun and hi-jinx.

results.title: Animals that build
results.creator_credit: Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: This film focuses on animals as engineers, constructing elaborate dwellings and protection devices. From tiny microscopic creatures like coral, insects like spiders and caterpillars through to birds and mammals like beavers and man, the program provides a useful insight into the natural world. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Animals see in many ways
results.creator_credit: Norman Bean and Norman Bean Films
results.brief_description: Presents a basic introduction to the ways in which different animals see. Shows that some animals have simple eyes and some have compound eyes, highlighting how these two eye-types function and how they aid the particular animal in functioning within its environment, eg the differences between the eye-types of hunted and hunter animals. Also defines lens, retina and iris. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Animals of the Indian jungle
results.creator_credit: F Von Keller, Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explores the dense tropical rain forest of eastern India, showing close up views of representative animals in their native environment - the crocodile, tiger, python, cobra, mongoose, monkey and elephant. Describes and illustrates the pattern of survival in the jungle, pointing out the ways of the hunters and the defences of the hunted. Photography by Jack Cardiff. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Animals of Australia (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Australian animals are as varied as the continent itself- from the red kangaroos of the inland to the platypus of the eastern highlands. This documentary contains original footage by nature photographer David Corke, together with extracts from some of the best known Australian films such as “Birth of the Red Kangaroo”, “The Echidna”, “The Lyrebird and the Fairy Penguins”.

results.title: Animals of Asia
results.creator_credit: Centron Films and Chatsworth Film Productions
results.brief_description: An overview of animals and birds of Asia. Includes flying foxes, snakes, deer, tigers, mud skippers and orangutans. Written by Michael Boorer of the Zoological Society of London. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Animals hear in many ways. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: George J. Holland, BFA Educational Media and Norman Bean Films
results.brief_description: Indicates that animals hear when sound vibrations produce similar vibrations in their own bodies. Shows that different parts of animals’ bodies may be specifically adapted to receive these vibrations. Shows the ways in which dogs, elephants, bats, fish, snakes and some insects hear. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
